verses.roman:
sūkṣma vastra āni' gaurika diyā rāṅgāilā
śimulīra tulā diyā tāhā pūrāilā

synonyms: sūkṣma vastra—fine cloth; āni'-bringing; gaurika—red oxide; diyā—with the help of; rāṅgāilā—made reddish; śimulīra—of the śimula tree; tulā—cotton; diyā—with; tāhā—that; pūrāilā—filled.
translation: He acquired some fine cloth and colored it with red oxide. Then he filled it with cotton from a śimula tree.
